sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a phase transition reaction
message_1: What is the standard enthalpy change for the phase transition from liquid water to steam at 100°C and 1 atm pressure, given that the molar heat of vaporization of water is 40.7 kJ/mol?
message_2:
The standard enthalpy change for the phase transition from liquid water to steam at 100°C and 1 atm pressure is equal to the molar heat of vaporization of water. In this case, the molar heat of vaporization is given as 40.7 kJ/mol. Therefore, the standard enthalpy change for this phase transition is:

ΔH = 40.7 kJ/mol
